mapfbench.description package¶

Submodules¶

mapfbench.description.mapscheme module¶

mapfbench.description.plan module¶

Module for representing a plan to solve a specific test scenario

class mapfbench.description.plan.Action(timestep: int, subject_id: int, action_type: ActionType, start_position: array | None = None, end_position: array | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents an action performed by an Agent as part of the plan

property action_type: ActionType¶

The type of action performed by the agent

static decode(dictionary: dict[str, Any]) → Action[source]¶
encode() → dict[str, Any][source]¶
property end_position: array | None¶

The ending position of the agent before the action

property start_position: array | None¶

The starting position of the agent before the action

property subject_id: int¶

The ID of the Agent performing the Action

property timestep: int¶

The timestep at which the action is performed

class mapfbench.description.plan.ActionType(value)[source]¶

Bases: IntEnum

Possible types of actions

MOVE = 1¶
WAIT = 0¶
class mapfbench.description.plan.Plan(scenario: Scenario, actions: ndarray[Action], metadata: dict[str, Any] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a plan to solve a specified Scenario The plan comprises the actions performed by each agent.

property actions: array¶

The list of the actions taken by the agents as part of the plans

agent_plan_by_id(agent_id: int) → array[source]¶

Returns the actions of the agent with the specified ID. If no agent with the given ID exists, None is returned

Parameters:

agent_id (int) – The ID of the agent whose actions are sought

Returns:

The list with the actions of the agent, None if the agent with the given ID does not exist

Return type:

list[Action], optional

property agent_plans: dict[Agent, list[Action]]¶

The plans of the agents, taken separately

Returns:

A dictionary with the agents on the map as keys and the list of actions they perform as values

Return type:

dict[Agent, list[Action]]

static decode(dictionary: dict[str, Any]) → Plan[source]¶
encode() → dict[str, Any][source]¶
property is_solved: bool¶

Whether the plan solves the scenario, that is all the agents reach their objective position

property memory_used: float | None¶

The memory usage in KB of the algorithm which computed the plan, if available

property metadata¶

The metadata associated with the plan

property running_time: float | None¶

The running time in ms of the algorithm which computed the plan, if available

property scenario: Scenario¶

The scenario solved by the plan

mapfbench.description.scenario module¶

Classes used to define a test scenario

class mapfbench.description.scenario.Agent(agent_id: int, start_position: tuple[int, int], objective_position: tuple[int, int])[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a single agent on the map Agents are uniquely identified by their IDs, so the __eq__ comparison checks only them

static decode(dictionary: dict[str, Any]) → Agent[source]¶
encode() → dict[str, Any][source]¶
property id: int¶

The identifying number of the agent

property objective_position: array¶

The objective position of the agent on the map

property start_position: array¶

The initial position of the agent on the map

class mapfbench.description.scenario.AgentReference(agent_id: int)[source]¶

Bases: Agent

Class that represents a reference to an agent, using its ID only. Use this class only to refer to an Agent used as key in a collection; the getters of start_position and objective_positions are overridden to return None.

property end_position: None¶
property start_position: None¶

The initial position of the agent on the map

class mapfbench.description.scenario.Scenario(map_scheme: MapScheme, agents: list[Agent], metadata: dict[str, Any] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a test scenario, characterized by a map and agents on it

property agent_ids: list[int]¶

The ids of the agents associated with the scenario

property agents: array¶

A list of the agents associated with the scenario

property agents_num: int¶

The number of agents associated with the scenario

static decode(dictionary: dict[str, Any]) → Scenario[source]¶
encode() → dict[str, Any][source]¶
static from_position_lists(map_scheme: MapScheme, start_positions: list[tuple[int, int]], objective_positions: list[tuple[int, int]])[source]¶

Generates a scenario from a list of starting positions and objectives. The start and objective positions with the same index i in the lists are associated to the Agent with ID i+1. If the lists have different length, they are truncated at the shortest length

Parameters:

  • map_scheme (MapScheme) – The map used for the scenario

  • start_positions (list[np.array]) – The starting positions of the agents

  • objective_positions (list[np.array]) – The objectives positions of the agents

Returns:

  • A Scenario instance, where the map is the provided one

  • and the Agents have start position and objectives positions

  • associated based on their index in the lists

Raises:

ValueError – If one of the lists contains an invalid position, no present in the map

property map: MapScheme¶

The map used for the scenario

property metadata¶

The metadata associated with the scenario

property objective_positions: array¶

The positions of the objectives in the scenario

property start_positions: array¶

The start positions of the agents in the scenario
